intro: Leptolepidium kuhnii, commonly known as the Kuhn's rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, mat-forming perennial that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape, and its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in racemes. It produces small, spherical pods that contain several seeds. Leptolepidium kuhnii is often found in high-altitude regions and is adapted to harsh, arid conditions.
